Key Match Events: Shivam Dube hit an unbeaten 60 as India defeated Afghanistan by six wickets in the first T20I in Mohali on Thursday.
A run-chase that got underway with a horrible mix-up, resulting in Rohit Sharma's run out.
Pre-Game Insights: India skipper Rohit Sharma has won the toss and opted to bowl first against Afghanistan on his T20I return after a gap of 14 months in the format.

In his toughest test yet in a blossoming T20 career, Rinku Singh proved his worth in the South African conditions and will be a key player for India in the middle-order, especially in the absence of the injured duo of Suryakumar Yadav and Hardik Pandya.
Post-Match Reflections: India win by 15 balls to spare, thanks to Shivam Dube's unbeaten 60. They take a 1-0 lead.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Chasing a target of 159, India defeated Afghanistan by six wickets in Mohali in the first T20I on Thursday.
Axar Patel and Mukesh Kumar bagged two wickets each to help India restrict Afghanistan to 158/5 in 20 overs.
Mohammad Nabi hits quickfire 42 for Afghanistan, while Azmatullah Omarzai played a rapid cameo of 29.
The pair added 68 runs for the fourth wicket before Mukesh dismissed both in the same over.
